benchmark_details.name: KoBALT (Korean Benchmark for Advanced Linguistic Tasks)
benchmark_details.overview: KoBALT is designed to advance the evaluation of large language models (LLMs) in Korean by addressing the limitations of conventional benchmarks that often lack linguistic depth and typological grounding. It comprises 700 linguistically-motivated multiple-choice questions covering 24 phenomena across five linguistic domains: syntax, semantics, pragmatics, phonetics/phonology, and morphology.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of KoBALT is to assess the advanced linguistic knowledge of large language models in a comprehensive manner.

data.source: Expert-curated multiple-choice questions designed by linguists.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is reported as the proportion of correctly predicted instances among the total number of questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance on linguistic tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: The highest-performing model achieved 61% overall accuracy.
methodology.validation: Validated through human preference evaluation with significant correlation to human judgments.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All materials were inspected to not include any harmful or biased statements, real-world names, or privacy invasions.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is licensed under Korea Open Government License (BY-NC-ND).
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: An internal ethics review was conducted for the preference evaluation.
